results.text: Where it is not possible to provide reliable insulation between information technology cables and metallic  bridges, any screens and armouring of the information technology cables shall at least be connected with the  conductive parts of both ends of the bridges in such a way as to be electrically conductive. A PEC shall be  used (see 4.3.7.3 for information). This, however, shall not apply in the case of direct current railway  installations because of electrolytic corrosion (see EN 50310).
The environmental conditions under which cabling components, inspection and test equipment are stored  shall be compatible with the manufacturers'/suppliers' specifications.

On metallic bridges and in tunnels containing electric railway tracks, cables with an insulated covering shall  be used. Information technology cables, of which the screen acts as protective earth conductor, shall be  insulated from conductive parts of metallic bridges. A PEC should be used (see 4.3.7.3 for information).
Requirements: the appearance, insulation resistance (6.2.6), contact resistance (6.2.5), voltage  proof (6.2.2) shall meet the requirements of this specification after test.

Requirements: the appearance, insulation resistance (6.2.6), voltage proof (6.2.2), contact  resistance (6.2.5), engaging and separating forces (6.3.4) shall meet the requirements of this  specification after test.
Equipment connected shall comply with the requirements for protection against electric shock of the relevant  product safety standards.

Requirements: the appearance, insulation resistance (6.2.6), voltage proof (6.2.2), contact  resistance (6.2.5), engaging and separating force (6.3.4) shall meet the requirements of this  specification after test.

The current-carrying capacity shall be verified according to IEC 60512-5-2, Test 5b, with the  maximum accepted cross-sectional area (2,5 mm2), to demonstrate compliance with the rated  current (20 A) and the upper limiting temperature (125 Â°C). See Figure 6 for the currenttemperature derating curve.
Fittings used to attach the information technology cabling to the supporting structures shall be specified to  have a voltage insulation of 4 kV at 50 Hz for one minute (minimum).

Requirements: the appearance, contact resistance (6.2.5), insulation resistance (6.2.6), voltage  proof (6.2.2), engaging and separating forces (6.3.4) and IP degree of protection (6.4.4) shall  meet the requirements of this specification after test.
Information technology cabling shall be connected to equipment that incorporates safe signal circuitry  complying with the SELV circuit and the TNV requirements as defined in the EN 60950 series.
electromagnetic protection provided to the cabling by reducing the common mode loop area. Where used,  the metallic conductor shall be:
1) the temperature and humidity shall be maintained to allow continuous operation of the active equipment;
The screen of the information technology cables between the connection enclosure (see Figure 7) and the  galvanic isolation device, if any, shall be insulated at both ends. The following applies:

201.4.4 A splice shall be provided with insulation  equivalent to that of the wires involved unless  permanent clearance and creepage distances are  maintained between the splice and other metal parts.  Insulation over the splice is not prohibited from having:

Requirements: the appearance, contact resistance (6.2.5), engaging and separating forces (6.3.4), contact retention in insert (6.3.5), voltage proof (6.2.2) and IP degree of protection  (6.4.4) shall meet the requirements of this specification after test.

Requirements: the appearance, contact resistance (6.2.5), engaging and separating forces (6.3.4), contact retention in insert (6.3.5), voltage proof (6.2.2) and IP degree of protection  (6.4.4) shall meet the requirements of this specification after test.

Cabling components shall be inspected for damage following delivery. Documentation supplied with the  components shall be checked for compliance with the procurement specification and shall be retained.
Conductive pathway systems in close proximity to HV power supply cabling shall be protected from electrical  hazards by means of protection earthing and/or sectioning.
Earthing connections at the PEC shall be made to the external surface of the conductor material.
